Covid19R Project Data Format

Source: vignettes/covid19R.Rmd
covid19R.Rmd

The refresh_coronavirus_jhu function enables to pull the coronavirus dataset using the Covid19R project data format standard. This data format includes the following fields:

  • date - The date of the observation, using Date class
  • location - The name of the location as provided by John Hopkins raw data
  • location_type - The type of the location field, either country or state
  • location_code - The location code, using the ios_3166_2 format
  • location_code_type - The location code type (ios_3166_2)
  • data_type - The case type, c("recovered_new", "cases_new", "deaths_new" )
  • value - The number of cases
  • lat - The latitude code
  • long - The longitude code
library(coronavirus)

covid19_df <- refresh_coronavirus_jhu()

head(covid19_df)
#>         date    location location_type location_code location_code_type
#> 1 2020-10-26 Afghanistan       country            AF         iso_3166_2
#> 2 2020-10-25 Afghanistan       country            AF         iso_3166_2
#> 3 2021-08-22 Afghanistan       country            AF         iso_3166_2
#> 4 2021-08-23 Afghanistan       country            AF         iso_3166_2
#> 5 2021-08-19 Afghanistan       country            AF         iso_3166_2
#> 6 2020-10-27 Afghanistan       country            AF         iso_3166_2
#>    data_type value      lat     long
#> 1 deaths_new     4 33.93911 67.70995
#> 2 deaths_new     3 33.93911 67.70995
#> 3  cases_new     0 33.93911 67.70995
#> 4  cases_new   135 33.93911 67.70995
#> 5  cases_new    48 33.93911 67.70995
#> 6 deaths_new     5 33.93911 67.70995
